passwordManagers.name: Bitwarden
passwordManagers.price: Free for basic features; Premium version at $10/year
features: Unlimited password storage across devices (free tier)
topFeedback: Bitwarden offers great value for its price and is highly secure.
passwordManagers.customerSupport: Email and ticketing support for Free; priority support for Premium users

passwordManagers.name: LastPass
passwordManagers.price: Free with limited features; Premium at $36/year
features: Autofill for passwords and personal information
topFeedback: LastPass is user-friendly and makes managing passwords effortless.
Its dark web monitoring is a great addition for added security.
passwordManagers.customerSupport: Priority support for Premium; community support for Free users

passwordManagers.name: Dashlane
passwordManagers.price: Free for limited use; Premium at $39.99/year
topFeedback: Dashlane combines a password manager with a VPN, which is a great combo.
The password health report is incredibly useful.
passwordManagers.customerSupport: 24/7 chat and email support for Premium users

secureBrowsingTools.name: NordVPN
features: Threat protection (blocks ads, trackers, and malware)
Double VPN and Onion over VPN for maximum privacy
topFeedback: NordVPN offers the best balance of speed and security.
The threat protection feature enhances overall browsing safety.

secureBrowsingTools.name: ExpressVPN
topFeedback: ExpressVPN has consistently high speeds and excellent global coverage.
It’s easy to use, even for non-technical users.
secureBrowsingTools.customerSupport: 24/7 live chat, email support, and troubleshooting guides

secureBrowsingTools.name: ProtonVPN
secureBrowsingTools.price: Free tier available; Paid plans start at $4.99/month
features: Secure Core servers for added protection
topFeedback: ProtonVPN is great for privacy-focused users, especially with its no-logs policy.
The free plan is excellent for basic browsing.
secureBrowsingTools.customerSupport: Email support for all users; priority support for paid plans

mfaApps.name: Google Authenticator
topFeedback: Simple, reliable, and highly secure for 2FA.
It’s great for anyone looking for a no-frills authenticator app.
mfaApps.customerSupport: Limited (Google support forums and help articles)

mfaApps.name: Authy
topFeedback: Authy is perfect for managing 2FA codes across multiple devices.
The cloud backup feature is a lifesaver for device changes.

mfaApps.name: Microsoft Authenticator
features: App lock with biometrics or PIN
topFeedback: Best for users with Microsoft accounts; integrates seamlessly.
